result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy Chen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1 in 15CF436, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $1,555.50 due today. Non-payment results in a 30 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 

To submit a DNA Sample
****PER 4-21-2016 ORDER - JOC is amended to add $100 in drug testing fees payable to the Jefferson County Drug Task Force****

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Chen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: FINANCIAL: Bkpg. re: unable to receipt check/money order
The Court hereby orders that Judgment of Conviction in the above captioned matter shall be amended to add $100 in drug testing fees payable to the Jefferson County Drug Task Force
Proposed Stipulation and Order to Amend JOC
from Attorney Stephen Eisenberg enclosing a copy of the Municipal Court Stipulation and Order
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
Time to Pay / Payment Extension Reminder

Cases 15CF436 & 16CM10 called at 3:52 pm [sf] 
Defendant Randy Chen in court with Attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

On 16CM10:
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.

Attorney Eisenberg advises that the defendant will be defaulting on the OWI 1st in Fort Atkinson Municipal Court.
Attorney Eisenberg advises that he is waiving his right to file suppression on Miranda issue.

On Motion of the State the Court amends Count #1 in 15CF436 to Possession of THC 961.41(3g)(e) Misdemeanor.
Court corrects plea form to include suspension as a penalty.
Attorney Eisenberg recites the elements on the record.

Constitutional rights given; plea of  "Guilty" entered on amended Count #1 in 15CF436, and Count #1 in 16CM10; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses the remaining counts in each case.

On Count #1 in 15CF436, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $1,555.50 due today.Non-payment results in a 30 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
To submit a DNA Sample

On Count #1 in 16CM10, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $1,555.50, due today. Non-payment results in a 30 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
To submit a DNA Sample

Recess: 4:12 pm
From SPD advising the defendant has requested SPD appear for bail purposes only

Case called at 1:16pm [mo]
Defendant Randy Chen appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek.  
Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Svehlek indicates that an eligibility determination has not been made at this time, SPD appears for bond purposes only

Atty. Svehlek verifies that the address and date of birth on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

The Court gives Mr. Chen his right to counsel and constructive waiver of counsel rights.
--Mr. Chen indicates that he will most likely obtain his own counsel.
recess 1:21 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/20/16 at 3:00pm   (2) Status Conference on 1/29/16 at 11:00am
